Package main

Class Game

java.lang.Object
main.Game
All Implemented Interfaces:
Runnable
public class Game extends Object implements Runnable
This class handle most logic pertaining to the game, including updates, FPS, level scale, and tile amount on screen.
Author:
John Botonakis and Sean-Paul Brown

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    private AudioPlayer
    audioPlayer
    This is the AudioPlayer that will play all of the audio in every state of the game
    private final int
    FPS_SET
    This is how many Frames Per Second there will be in game, how often the draw function is called.
    static final int
    GAME_HEIGHT
    The amount of pixels tall that the game is (already scaled)
    static final int
    GAME_WIDTH
    The amount of pixels wide that the game is (already scaled)
    private GamePanel
    gamePanel
    The GamePanel where to draw the Game
    private Thread
    gameThread
    This is Thread that the main game will be running on
    private Instructions
    instructions
    This will show the options menu
    private Menu
    menu
    This Menu class will be the main menu of the game
    private final double
    NANOSECONDS_IN_SEC
    This is the amount of nanoseconds in 1 second: 1 Billion nanoseconds.
    private Overworld
    overworld
    This Overworld class will show all of the levels available for selection in the game
    static final float
    PIT_DEPTH
    the amount of pixels there are before "falling" out of the world.
    private Playing
    playing
    This is the Playing class that will show all of the levels
    static final float
    SCALE
    This allows the game to be scaled to different screen sizes
    static final int
    TILES_DEFAULT_SIZE
    How tall and wide each tile is (they should be squares) in pixels
    static final int
    TILES_IN_HEIGHT
    This is the amount of tiles tall the game is, how many tiles should be drawn vertically
    static final int
    TILES_IN_WIDTH
    This is the amount of tiles wide the game is, how many tiles should be drawn horizontally
    static final int
    TILES_SIZE
    The size of the tiles scaled with the Game
    private final int
    UPS_SET
    This is how many Updates Per Second there will be in game, how often the update function is called.

    • NANOSECONDS_IN_SEC

      private final double NANOSECONDS_IN_SEC
      This is the amount of nanoseconds in 1 second: 1 Billion nanoseconds. This is used in the run method instead of the real number so it is easier to read

  • Constructor Details

      public Game()

  • Method Details

    • startGame

      public void startGame()
      This needs to be called in order for the Game to be started.
      Begins the main loop on a separate thread Done to dedicate a specific thread to free up logical traffic

    • initClasses

      private void initClasses()
      Initializes each of the states in a specific order.

    • run

      public void run()
      Handles the update aspects of the game, such as updates to logical processes and frames per second
      Specified by:
      run in interface Runnable

    • render

      public void render(Graphics g)
      Sets the currently drawn screen based on what state the game is in (from GameStates.state)
      Parameters:
      g - - the Graphics where to draw the screens

    • updateGameState

      public void updateGameState()
      Updates the current game state based on the GameStates.state

    • windowLost

      public void windowLost()
      This function handles when the Game loses system-focus. It will pause the game when Playing.
